title: Knowing God Commandments Quiz - Biblical Commands About Knowing God
description: Test your knowledge of the 14 biblical commandments related to knowing god. Covers 8 positive and 6 negative commandments from the Torah.

questions.question: Which positive commandment requires us to recognize the unity of G-d?
options: Know that G-d is One, a complete Unity
questions.correctAnswer: Know that G-d is One, a complete Unity
questions.explanation: Commandment #3 is a positive commandment instructing to know that G-d is one, found in Deuteronomy 6:4.

questions.question: Which commandment explicitly forbids having any other gods before the LORD?
options: Do not entertain thoughts of other gods besides G-d
questions.correctAnswer: Do not entertain thoughts of other gods besides G-d
questions.explanation: Commandment #2 is a negative commandment forbidding idolatry, stated in Exodus 20:3.

questions.question: True or False: The commandment to 'Sanctify G-d's Name' is a negative commandment.
questions.explanation: Commandment #6 is a positive commandment requiring sanctification of G-d’s name, as found in Leviticus 22:32.

questions.question: Where in Scripture is the commandment to 'Love G-d with all your heart, soul, and might' found?
questions.explanation: Commandment #4 instructs to love G-d fully and is found in Deuteronomy 6:5.

questions.question: Which commandment prohibits putting the LORD your God to the test?
options: Do not entertain thoughts of other gods besides G-d
questions.explanation: Commandment #10 forbids testing G-d beyond what is appropriate, as stated in Deuteronomy 6:16.

questions.question: True or False: The commandment 'Know there is a G-d' is a negative commandment.
questions.explanation: Commandment #1 is a positive commandment affirming belief in G-d, from Exodus 20:2.

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT one of the negative commandments in the G-d category?
questions.explanation: Commandment #11 is positive, instructing to walk in G-d’s ways, while the others are negative prohibitions.

questions.question: What practical behavior is required by the positive commandment to 'Cleave to those who know G-d (and His Law)'?
options: Associate closely and learn from those who fear G-d
questions.correctAnswer: Associate closely and learn from those who fear G-d
questions.explanation: Commandment #12 encourages close association and loyalty to those knowledgeable in G-d’s ways, based on Deuteronomy 10:20.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: The commandment 'You shall not profane My holy name' is found in ________.
questions.explanation: Commandments #6 and #7 both cite Leviticus 22:32 forbidding profaning G-d’s name.

questions.question: True or False: Swearing in G-d's Name to confirm truth when necessary is a positive commandment.
questions.explanation: Commandment #213 is positive, permitting swearing by G-d’s name for truth confirmation, from Deuteronomy 10:20.

questions.question: Which commandment emphasizes fearing, serving, and clinging to the LORD your God?
questions.explanation: Commandment #5 instructs reverent fear, service, and clinging to G-d, as described in Deuteronomy 10:20.

questions.question: Which negative commandment shares the same verse as the prohibition against cursing G-d?
options: Do not entertain thoughts of other gods besides G-d
questions.explanation: Commandment #567 forbids cursing judges, sharing Exodus 22:28 with the prohibition against cursing G-d (commandment #26).

questions.question: What does the positive commandment to 'Emulate G-d's ways' entail practically?
options: Walking in His ways by keeping commandments and holiness
questions.correctAnswer: Walking in His ways by keeping commandments and holiness
questions.explanation: Commandment #11 explains that holiness is achieved by following G-d’s ways and commandments, from Deuteronomy 28:9.

questions.question: Which commandment forbids cursing the head of state or leader of the Sanhedrin?
options: Do not curse the head of state or leader of the Sanhedrin
Do not entertain thoughts of other gods besides G-d
questions.correctAnswer: Do not curse the head of state or leader of the Sanhedrin
questions.explanation: Commandment #568 forbids cursing prominent leaders, cited in Exodus 22:28.

questions.question: In which book and chapter is the commandment 'Know there is a G-d' found?
questions.explanation: Commandment #1 is from Exodus 20:2, affirming belief in G-d as the redeemer from Egypt.
